span.p: KG Registration for 20/21 school year can now be done online by choosing New Student Registration under Quick Links on District Home page.

We are extremely grateful for all of the organizations and community members who have offered their support in so many ways during this difficult time. The unwavering willingness of this community to support each other is remarkable.

div.a: School Closure Extended Through the End of the School Year

div.span: On April 20, 2020, Governor Mike DeWine made an announcement ordering all of Ohio’s public, community, and private K-12 school buildings to be closed to students for the remainder of the ...

a.title: Click to read more about: School Closure Extended Through the End of the School Year

span.p: Due to the Stay at Home Order in association with the COVID-19 pandemic being extended to May 1st, we have decided to postpone the Kindergarten Screening sessions. These sessions were to take place May 5-7, which currently would be the first week back to school should the order expire on May 1. Once we have set a new date for the Kindergarten Screening, we will be in contact with each family to get their child scheduled for a new screening date. Thanks so much for your flexibility and understanding during this fluid and unprecedented time.

a.title: Click to read more about: Kindergarten Screening Update

div.a: Vaccine Requirements for Students Entering 12th Grade Fall 2020

span.p: Beginning with the 2016-2017 school year, students entering the 12th grade are required to have 2 doses* of MCV4 (meningococcal- serogroup A, C, W, and Y).

This means that those students who are currently in 11th grade, will have to be vaccinated with this vaccines before the beginning of school in the fall. Any student not submitting documentation of this vaccine may be excluded from school.

To have your child vaccinated, call and schedule an appointment with your primary care physician or call the Preble County General Health District Immunization Clinic. The PCGHD Immunization Clinic is held every Monday (except holidays) from 9:00 – 11:00 a.m. and 3:00 – 5:00 p.m. Please contact the PCGHD at 937-472-0087 ext. 226 to schedule an appointment or for additional information.

div.a: Vaccine Requirements for Students Entering 7th Grade in Fall 2020

span.p: Beginning with the 2016-2017 school year, students entering the 7th grade are required to have MCV4 (meningococcal- serogroup A, C, W, and Y).
As in the past, 7th grade students are required to have documentation of a Tdap (tetanus, diphtheria, and acellular pertussis) vaccine.

This means that those students who are currently in 6th grade, will have to be vaccinated with both vaccines before the beginning of school in the fall. Any student not submitting documentation of these vaccines may be excluded from school.

To have your child vaccinated, call and schedule an appointment with your primary care physician or call the Preble County General Health District Immunization Clinic. The PCGHD Immunization Clinic is held every Monday (except holidays) from 9:00 – 11:00 a.m. and 3:00 – 5:00 p.m. Please contact the PCGHD at 937-472-0087 ext. 226 to schedule an appointment or for additional information.
